name: Richard Silverton
summary:
I am a full-stack developer with a background in finance and more than 3 years experience working with Node.js, React and MongoDB. I also have significant commercial experience with React Native, Webpack, Bash, AWS, Git, Meteor.js, Express.js, and Ansible.

I love the power and versatility of Javascript, particularly ES6, whilst also believing strongly in the capacity of functional programming paradigms (immutability, pure functions) to produce bug-free, maintainable code. I'm also enthusiastic about atomic CSS libraries (e.g. Tachyons) for achieving a tidy code-base, although I have significant experience with Sass and Less as well.

My other interests include neural networks, and I've developed libraries for working with neural nets in both Javascript and ReasonML.

I'm a co-organiser of the London Meteor meetup, at which I've presented on a multitude of occasions (1)(2)(3), speaking about all aspects of full-stack development, and demonstrating a series of personal projects.

1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-yPPPjCk_I2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rWcXAhUkp6Y3: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O15hAIsncO8

employmentHistory.description:
Working as part of a boutique agency, I build complex web and native applications from the ground up for clients across a range of industries, from startups to major international corporations. Our approach follows Agile principles, delivering work in focused, week-long sprints with clearly defined goals.

Tech stacks vary between projects, but are all based on Node.js and MongoDB, with some combination of Express.js, Hapi and Meteor.js on the back-end, and React, Blaze/Handlebars, Jade/Pug or Angular 1.x on the front-end. All of our green-field projects over the past 18 months have been based on React and Redux, with one major native app delivered using React Native.

Achieving extensive test coverage is also a major tenet of our philosophy, with Mocha and Tape used for unit and integration tests, and Webdriver.io for end-to-end testing. As part of a small team, I am also responsible for deployment and support, the former largely via Ansible, although I've recently experimented with Docker for increased predictability across environments.

I was responsible for delivering the financial analysis component of the organisation's bids for the Ministry of Justice's ground-breaking Transforming Rehabilitation initiative. I reported directly to the charity's board and the MoJ on all financial aspects of the process.

After deciding to leave trading to become a developer, I spent around a year intensively teaching myself Python and Javascript via online resources including Udacity and Coursera.  I put these skills to work by developing sites for my running club's racing league, a fantasy biathlon game which was internationally popular and mentioned on TV, a successful e-commerce site and an annual charity football event, amongst other personal projects.

employmentHistory.role: Vice president, Short-term interest rates trading
employmentHistory.description: I was responsible for market-making and discretionary trading of international interest rate products and foreign exchange to manage credit, market and funding risks. I also provided market intelligence and personal trading views to high-profile clients including central banks.
I developed a flexible CDO pricing model which could be calibrated to prevailing market correlations in Matlab.
